document.masterDocTitle: North American species of Diamphidaxona (Acari: Hydrachnida: Hygrobatidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: North American species of Diamphidaxona (Acari: Hydrachnida: Hygrobatidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:

Etymology. Named for the Chihuahuan Desert biome where all known specimens of this species have been collected.
Distribution. Streams in the desert mountain ranges of southwestern New Mexico and southeastern Arizona.

Remarks. Adults of
Diamphidaxona chihuahua
differ from those of all other known North American species of
Diamphidaxona (s. s.)
in that the projections covering the insertions of the fourth pair of legs are short and extend laterally to the edges of the ventral shield.
